title: Cat. 82  Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina, 1894/95
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina  
1894/95  
Wood-block print in black ink, over brush and solvent thinned and selectively applied yellow ocher, reddish-orange and touches of green and pink wax-and-resin-based media (est.), on cream wove paper, 148 × 119 mm (image/sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Edward McCormick Blair, 2002.245  
Guérin 44, Kornfeld 32

Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina  
1894/95  
Wood-block print in black ink, over brush and solvent thinned and selectively applied ocher, reddish-orange and touches of green wax-and-resin-based media (est.), on cream wove paper; 150 × 120 mm (image/sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Frank B. Hubachek, 1947.471  
Guérin 44, Kornfeld 32

Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina  
1894/95  
Wood-block print in reddish-brown ink with blue-gray watercolor on ivory wove paper, laid down on ivory wove paper; 142 × 99 mm (image/primary/secondary support, trimmed)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, Clarence Buckingham Collection, 1948.268  
Guérin 44, Kornfeld 32

</section><section id="figures">Top left, Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina, 1894/95 (cat. 82.1). Top right, Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina, 1894/95 (cat. 82.2). Bottom, Tahitian Idol—the Goddess Hina, 1894/95 (cat. 82.3).

</section>
